title: In Navy experiment, commercial satellites serve as key weapons against drug traffickers
key_assets: ['ICEYE SAR satellites', 'Planet electro-optical satellites', 'Royce Geo AI platform for satellite imagery collection', 'Acoustic sensor network']
summary: The U.S. Navy, through the Office of Naval Research, conducted an experiment using commercial satellite data, including ICEYE's SAR satellites, to detect and identify drug-trafficking vessels. Royce Geospatial Consultants won a contract from the Naval Surface Warfare Center to continue these experiments in support of the Navy's Joint Interagency Task Force South.
why_it_matters: This contract demonstrates the growing reliance of military and defense agencies on commercial space assets, particularly SAR satellites like those operated by ICEYE, to enhance real-time intelligence and operational efficiency in tracking illicit activities.
